paper_abstract: We propose output deviations as a surrogate metric to grade functional test sequences at the register-transfer level without explicit fault simulation. Experimental results for the open-source Biquad filter core and the Scheduler module of the Illinois Verilog Model show that the deviations metric is computationally efficient and it correlates well with gate-level coverage for stuck-at, transition-delay and bridging faults. Results also show that functional test sequences reordered based on output deviations provide steeper gate-level fault coverage ramp-up compared to other ordering methods.
paper_title: Functional Test-Sequence Grading at Register-Transfer Level
